name: Basic Javascript Code
description: If you want to become a web developer, you’ll be wondering what programming languages to learn? Javascript should be your first and essential choices.
whatlearn: Become an advanced, confident, and modern JavaScript developer from scratch
Build 6 beautiful real-world projects for your portfolio (not boring toy apps)
Become job-ready by understanding how JavaScript really works behind the scenes
Course pathways: design your unique learning path according to your goals!
How to think and work like a developer: problem-solving, researching, workflows
JavaScript fundamentals: variables, if/else, operators, boolean logic, functions, arrays, objects, loops, strings, etc.
Modern ES6+ from the beginning: arrow functions, destructuring, spread operator, optional chaining (ES2020), etc.
Modern OOP: Classes, constructors, prototypal inheritance, encapsulation, etc.
Complex concepts like the 'this' keyword, higher-order functions, closures etc.
Asynchronous JavaScript: Event loop, promises, async/await, AJAX calls and APIs
How to architect your code using flowcharts and common patterns
Modern tools for 2022 and beyond: NPM, Parcel, Babel and ES6 modules
Practice your skills with 50+ challenges and assignments (solutions included)
Get fast and friendly support in the Q&A area
contents: JavaScript Releases: ES5, ES6+ and ESNext

name: Advance JS & React Bootcamp
description: So the first reason you should learn ReactJS is because it is the most loved and used web library among professional developers
whatlearn: Build powerful, fast, user-friendly and reactive web apps
Provide amazing user experiences by leveraging the power of JavaScript with ease
Apply for high-paid jobs or work as a freelancer in one the most-demanded sectors you can find in web dev right now
Learn all about React Hooks and React
contents: What Are Components? And Why Is React All About Them?
React Code Is Written In A Declarative Way!
A Note About New React Projects & NodeJS
Outputting Dynamic Data & Working with Expressions in JSX
Adding normal JavaScript Logic to Components
Time to Practice: React & Component Basics

name: Bootstrap A to Z
description: Bootstrap is a powerful front-end framework that allows developers to create responsive websites and web applications. It provides a wide range of features and components that can be used to create beautiful and user-friendly interfaces. Bootstrap is also easy to learn and use, which makes it an ideal choice for those who are new to web development.
whatlearn: Learn how to create and use all 24 components, 9 helpers and 16 utilities of the latest version of Bootstrap 5
Learn how to customize and extend Bootstrap 5 with Sass: change global options and customize color, layout, content, forms, components, helpers and utilities
How to create fluid and responsive layouts
How to structure all kinds of conten
Accessibility best practices
Practice with a special built Bootstrap 5 Learning Kit (200+ source files) and 38 coding exercises featuring more than 200 automated tests against your code
How to use breakpoints and the grid system
How to create 6 different responsive projects

name: Learn Tailwind in 24 hour
description: This is a fun project-based course to learn how to create awesome layouts using the Tailwind CSS framework and get comfortable using utility classes over something like Bootstrap, which uses component-based classes. Let's take a look at the outline for this course
whatlearn: Learn to create and edit layouts super fast
Learn the Tailwind utility classes using a code sandbox
Build 5 mini-projects and 6 website projects
Learn how to set up a dev environment using the Tailwind CLI
Configure your styles to create custom layouts

name: Basic to Advance Python
description: Python is an in-demand, accessible programming language with an active, ever-growing community of users. For anyone looking to switch careers into the tech world through coding, Python is a great place to start.
contents: Getting the Notebooks and the Course Material
I/O with Basic Files in Python
Python Objects and Data Structures Assessment Test Overview
Python Objects and Data Structures Assessment Test Solutions
whatlearn: You will master the Python programming language by building 100 unique projects over 100 days.
You will learn automation, game, app and web development, data science and machine learning all using Python.
You will be able to program in Python professionally
You will learn Selenium, Beautiful Soup, Request, Flask, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit Learn, Plotly, and Matplotlib.
Create a portfolio of 100 Python projects to apply for developer jobs
Be able to build fully fledged websites and web apps with Python
Be able to use Python for data science and machine learning
Build games like Blackjack, Pong and Snake using Python
Build GUIs and Desktop applications with Python

name: Learn Node
description: Using Node It's easy to send and synchronize the data between server-side and client-side coding. Because of using the same language Javascript on both sides your source code will be cleaner and more consistent.
whatlearn: Work with one of the most in-demand web development programming languages
Learn the basics as well as advanced concepts of NodeJS in great detail
Build modern, fast and scalable server-side web applications with NodeJS, databases like SQL or MongoDB and more
Understand the NodeJS ecosystem and build server-side rendered apps, REST APIs and GraphQL APIs
Get a thorough introduction to DenoJS

name: Full Stack Django
description: Django is a high-level Python web framework that enables rapid development of secure and maintainable websites. Built by experienced developers, Django takes care of much of the hassle of web development,
whatlearn: Create a fully functional web site using the Full-Stack with Django 1.11
Learn how to use HTML to create website content
Use CSS to create beautifully styled sites
Learn how to take advantage of Bootstrap to quickly style sites
Use Javascript to interact with sites on the Front-End
Learn how to use jQuery to quickly work with the DOM
Understand HTTP requests
Create fantastic landing pages
Learn the power of Python to code out your web applications
Use Django as a back end for the websites
Implement a full Models-Views-Templates structure for your site
contents: Introduction to URLs, Views, and Routing
Connecting a View to a Template

name: Complete Web Development
description: High earning potential, opportunity for growth, and flexibility are usually top of mind for most who get into the industry. Some of the challenges for people who pursue web development is the competitive nature of the job market.
whatlearn: Prepare for Industry Certification Exam
Earn Certification that is Proof of your Competence
Hours and Hours of Video Instruction
Dozens of Code Examples to Download and Study

All Lab Solutions

All Free Tools
Comprehensive Coverage of HTML and CSS
Client Side Programming with Javascript
Server Side Development with PHP
Learn Database Development with mySQL
